div1.p: This is an outline, organized chronologically, of Kean's experience with the Yellow Fever Commission.

div1.head: Report: Walter Reed & Yellow Fever. Chronology of the Yellow Fever Work in Cuba, 1899 and 1900 and Personal Experiences, by Jefferson Randolph Kean, [1901?]
div1.opener:
IV
May 4 1899 Walter Reed & Major Arthur came to lunch -- to say 113
Dept Hqds moved into Toledo House May 13, 1899 -- p. 115
Standing Med Dept in Cuba Diary IV p 118
I move to Toledo House May 17, 1900
WALTER REED & YELLOW FEVER.
CHRONOLOGY OF THE YELLOW FEVER WORK IN CUBA, 1899 AND 1900
AND PERSONAL EXPERIENCES.
Major J.R. Kean
div1.p:
I arrived in Havana with 1st Div. 7th Army Corps of which I was Chief
Surgeon. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Dec. 29, 1898
Diary 97
✓Saw my first case of yellow fever. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Jan. 24, 1899
Became Chief Surgeon 7th Army Corps and Lieut. Col. Vols.. . . . . . . .Feb. 11, 1899
✓Walter Reed came to Cuba to investigate typhoid epidemic in camp at Puerto
Principe . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ..May 4, 1899
June 23.
Yellow fever epidemic in Santiago. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .June & July "
Aug 17 Frangui p 133 p 145.
Yellow fever at Marianao . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .July & Aug "
General Leonard Wood supercedes Gen. Brooke as Gov. General of Cuba. . .Dec. 20, 1899
Gorgas succeeds Davis as Sanitary Officer of City of Havana. . . . . . .Feb. 10, 1900
✓Reed comes to Havana to investigate Electrozone Plant for making disin-
fectant out of sea water . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Mar. 10, 1900
Aug 17 -- 138 Real Col Nov. 21 -- p 145
Yellow Fever in Marianao . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .May & June " p. 166
I am taken with yellow fever . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .June 21, 1900
✓Reed arrives in Cuba and came to see me the same day . . . . . . . . . .June 25, 1900
Yellow Fever Board organized . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .June 26, 1900
Reed and Agramonte investigated yellow fever in camp at Pinar del Rio. .July 21, 1900
Reed Board taken up the Finlay theory of transmission of yellow fever by
mosquitoes for investigation about . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .. . .Aug. 1, 1900
✓Reed called back to United States by death of Dr. Shakespeare about. . .Aug. 7, 1900
First experiments by Board with mosquitoes - Dr. A. S. Pinto, members of
the Board and others bitten without result . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ..Aug. 11, 1900
I returned to Havana from sick leave in U. S.. . . . . . . . . . . . . .Aug. 13, 1900
Carroll bitten by infected mosquito. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Aug. 27, 1900
Taken sick with yellow fever . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Aug. 31, 1900
Private Wm. H. Dean, Troop B., 7th Cav. (XY) bitten. . . . . . . . . . .Aug. 31, 1900
Taken sick with yellow fever . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Sept. 5, 1900
Lazear taken sick with yellow fever. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Sept. 18, 1900
Lazear died. . .. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Sept. 25, 1900
on U S. Transport Crook
Reed returns from the U. S. about. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Oct. 4, 1900
Reed and I go to see General Wood to get approval of human experiments
and promise of assistance with money . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ..Oct. 12, 1900
Reed leaves for the United States. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Oct. 13, 1900
I issue circular to Medical Officers, General Lee's command to begin
mosquito work. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Oct. 15, 1900
Reed returns from the United States. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Oct. 23, 1900
Colonel Havard, Chief Surgeon goes on leave and I become Acting C. Surg.
Department of Cuba . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Nov. 19, 1900
Camp Lazear completed. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Nov. 20, 1900
Experiments begun at Camp Lazear . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Nov. 20, 1900
Experiments with infected bedding begin. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Nov. 30, 1900
until Jan. 10, 1901, Dr. R. P. Cooke and others
Kissinger bitten by infected mosquito Nov. 20, Nov. 23 and . . . . . . .Dec. 5, 1900
Kissinger taken sick . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . ... . . . . . . . .Dec. 9, 1900
Yellow Fever Board confirms cases. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Dec. 16, 1900
Gen. Order No. 6, Dept. Cuba, directing warfare on mosquitoes by medical
officers all stations. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Dec. 21, 1900
Dinner to Cr. Carlos Finlay, to celebrate the demonstration by Reed of his
theory . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Dec. 22, 1900
Gen. Lee goes to US Sept 3 1900 on Rawlins
General Wood, Finlay, Reed, Gorgas and about 60 Cuban physicians there. I Dec 22 1900
sat on Dr. Finlay's right.
Colonel Havard returns to Cuba. . . . . . . . . ... . . . . . . ..Jan. 8, 1901
I left Havana for Washington for examination for promotion as Major M.C. Jan. 30, 1901
I talked to Gorgas just before leaving and urged him to join the rest of us
in accepting Reed's demonstration before the Pan American Med. Congress met in Feb. 7
Feb. He said that he believed that Reed had been able to cause it by the bites
of mosquitoes, but he did not believe that it was the only way, or even the
most usual way.

Reed's paper announcing the demonstration of transmission of yellow fever by
mosquito at Pan American Medical Congress held in Havana. . . . . . . .Feb. 4-7, 1901
Reed leaves Cuba. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Feb. 9, 1901
I returned to Havana. .from Satiago de Cuba . . . . .about.Feb. 20, 1901
Gorgas begins mosquito work in Havana . . . . . . . . . . . . . .about.Mar. 1, 1901
or after
C. Surg. issues circular No. 5 Dept. of Cuba directing discontinuance
of disinfection for yellow fever. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .Apr. 27, 1901
Last case originating in Havana . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .May 7, 1901
Carroll returns to Havana for experiments with filtered blood of y. f. .Aug. 11, 1901
Gorgas ceases disinfection of bedding & clothing for yellow fever . . .Aug. 15, 1901
Gen Lee & the Starks went on bar Sept 3, 1900
